page.title: 14LIMERIGG FORESTRY
page.content: Two sections of land,covering more than 400 acres,have been planted by the Forestry Commission. Lodge-Pole Pines were planted on deep peat while Sitka Spruce were planted on the shallower peat. There are also some Larch trees on the outskirts of the forest. The planting took place in the early 1960's. At that time each pupil of our school planted a tree which was then ringed with the child's name. Until the late 1970's,forestry workers lived in the village and worked locally but now all work is directed from Aberfoyle. The forest is plentiful in wild life. One might see the grey squirrel,deer,rabbits/hares, foxes,birds etc. There are several pathways through the forest which provide popular walks for the local residents.
